page.title: 01A GENERAL VIEW
page.content:
Hawick is a town roughly 80 km south-west of Edinburgh. Its population is approx. 16,000 and it has two main rivers, the Teviot and the Slitrig. The main industry in Hawick is knitwear, for which the town is famous, all over the world. The town also has a unique sweet, the "Hawick Ball".
There are many sheep around Hawick but nowadays their wool is not used in the local knitwear factories. Most of the cattle round Hawick are beef cattle, not suitable for milking.
Wilton Lodge Park, with lots of amusements, such as crazy golf, putting,trampolining, six rugby pitches, two bowling greens, etc. is another special feature of Hawick.
